item.title: 两名共和党人希望五角大楼将中国电池制造商 CATL 列入限制名单
item.description: 两位共和党高级议员周三要求美国国防部将中国电池制造商 CATL 列入据称与北京军方合作的公司限制名单。【原文：Two top Republican lawmakers on Wednesday asked the U.S. Defense Department to add Chinese battery maker CATL to a restricted list of companies allegedly working with Beijing's military.】

item.title: 暂停后，Alphabet 将在双子座上推出图像生成器
item.description: Alphabet 周三表示，它已经更新了 Gemini 的人工智能图像创建模型，并将在未来几天内推出生成人物视觉图像的功能，此前该功能已暂停数月之久。【原文：Alphabet said on Wednesday it has updated Gemini's AI image-creation model and would roll out the generation of visuals of people in the coming days, after months-long pause of the capability.】

item.title: 美国旅行者将以创纪录的劳动节航空旅行为夏季画上圆满句号
item.description: 美国的航空公司和机场正在为最繁忙的劳动节周末做准备，因为将有创纪录数量的旅行者收拾行囊，准备在旅游季节结束前乘飞机去享受最后一次夏日之旅。【原文：U.S. airlines and airports are gearing up for the busiest Labor Day weekend, as a record number of travelers pack their bags and prepare to jet off to squeeze one last summer trip before the season ends.】

item.title: 在巴西，Meta 因允许虚假的哈万广告而面临 360 万美元的罚款
item.description: 巴西连锁百货公司 Havan 起诉 Meta Platforms，指控该社交媒体公司接受付费广告，欺诈性地使用该零售商的名称欺骗消费者，Meta Platforms 在败诉后面临最高 362 万美元的罚款。【原文：Meta Platforms faces a fine of up to $3.62 million after losing a lawsuit by Brazilian department store chain Havan that accused the social media company of accepting paid advertisements that fraudulently use the retailer's name to deceive consumers.】

item.title: 环保组织称，马斯克的 xAI 数据中心在未经许可的情况下运行燃气轮机
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司 xAI 正面临着来自环境和健康倡导者的批评，据称该公司在未获得必要许可的情况下，在其数据中心使用天然气涡轮机，造成了田纳西州孟菲斯市的污染。【原文：Elon Musk's AI startup, xAI, is facing criticism from environmental and health advocates for allegedly contributing to pollution in Memphis, Tennessee, by using natural gas-burning turbines at its data center without obtaining necessary permits.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会威胁起诉 NFT 市场 OpenSea 首席执行官称
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（SEC）首席执行官周三在社交媒体平台 X 上发文称，美国证券交易委员会（SEC）威胁要起诉不可兑换代币（NFTs）市场 OpenSea。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has threatened to sue non-fungible tokens (NFTs) marketplace OpenSea, its CEO said in a post on social media platform X on Wednesday.】

item.title: 赛博朋克制造商 CD Projekt 上半年净利润增长 88
item.description: 波兰最大的游戏开发商 CD Projekt 周三公布，受其旗舰游戏《赛博朋克》（Cyberpunk）销量增加的推动，该公司上半年净利润同比增长 88%。【原文：Poland's biggest games developer CD Projekt posted on Wednesday an 88% year-on-year jump in its first-half net profit, driven by higher sales of its flagship Cyberpunk game.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会要求每月报告投资基金持股情况
item.description: 华尔街最高监管机构周三以 3 比 2 的投票结果批准了新规则的修改，要求共同基金和交易所交易基金每月而不是每年四次报告投资组合的持有情况。【原文：Wall Street's top regulator on Wednesday voted 3-2 to approve new rule changes requiring mutual funds and exchange-traded funds to report portfolio holdings on a monthly basis rather than four times a year, which officials said would bring greater transparency to investors and regulators.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，国际货币基金组织团队将于下周访问乌克兰，进行预算和贷款审查
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道，国际货币基金组织将于下周与乌克兰官员会面，审查这个饱受战争蹂躏的国家的预算前景，并决定是否从 156 亿美元的援助计划中再拨付 11 亿美元。【原文：The International Monetary Fund will meet with Ukrainian officials next week to review the war-torn country's budget outlook and decide whether to disburse the next $1.1 billion from a $15.6 billion aid program, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度对迪士尼与信实集团交易的反垄断担忧
item.description: 华特迪士尼公司和信实工业公司周三获得了印度竞争委员会（CCI）的批准，将以 85 亿美元合并其在印度的媒体资产，此前双方在控制印度最受欢迎的运动--板球的转播权方面做出了让步。【原文：Walt Disney Co and Reliance Industries won approval from the Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Wednesday for an $8.5 billion merger of their Indian media assets after offering concessions relating to their grip on broadcasting rights for cricket, India's favourite sport.】

item.title: 萨拉-佩林在《纽约时报》诽谤案中赢得重审
item.description: 萨拉-佩林（Sarah Palin）周三赢得了对《纽约时报》的重新审判，原因是《纽约时报》的一篇社论被这位前阿拉斯加州州长认为具有诽谤性。【原文：Sarah Palin on Wednesday won her bid for a new trial against the New York Times over an editorial that the former Alaska governor said was defamatory.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会准备要求每月报告投资基金持股情况
item.description: 华尔街最高监管机构将于周三批准新的规则变更，要求共同基金和交易所交易基金按月而不是一年四次报告投资组合持有情况，为投资者带来更大的透明度。【原文：Wall Street's top regulator is set to approve new rule changes on Wednesday that require mutual funds and exchange-traded funds to report portfolio holdings on a monthly basis rather than four times a year, bringing greater transparency to investors, officials said.】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司市值突破 1 万亿美元
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的市值本周三超过了 1 万亿美元，这反映了投资者对沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）用近六十年时间打造的这家企业集团的信心，许多人认为它是美国经济的代表。【原文：The market value of Berkshire Hathaway surpassed $1 trillion on Wednesday, reflecting investor confidence in the conglomerate that Warren Buffett built over nearly six decades into what many consider a proxy for the American economy.】

item.title: Dick's Sporting Goods 披露未经授权的第三方获取信息的情况
item.description: 迪克体育用品公司（Dick's Sporting Goods）周三表示，该公司上周发现有未经授权的第三方访问了其信息系统，包括某些机密数据。【原文：Dick's Sporting Goods said on Wednesday it discovered last week that an unauthorized third party had access to its information systems, including certain confidential data.】

item.title: 超微计算机公司推迟年度申报
item.description: 超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer）周三表示，将推迟提交截至 6 月 30 日的财年年度报告，导致这家人工智能服务器制造商的股价在盘前交易中下跌约 8%。【原文：Super Micro Computer said on Wednesday it would delay the filing of its annual report for the fiscal year ended June 30, sending the AI server maker's shares down about 8% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 由于需求放缓，Jif 花生酱生产商 JM Smucker 下调了年度预期
item.description: Jif花生酱生产商J.M. Smucker周三下调了年度销售和利润预期，原因是在通胀胶着的情况下，注重成本的消费者转而选择价格较低的替代品，导致其股价在盘前交易中下跌了4%。【原文：Jif peanut butter maker J.M. Smucker cut annual sales and profit forecasts on Wednesday, hurt by cost-conscious consumers switching to lower-priced alternatives amid sticky inflation, sending its shares down 4% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 美国法院裁定，TikTok 必须面对 10 岁女孩死亡的诉讼
item.description: 一名 10 岁女孩在参加了一次病毒式 "停电挑战 "后死亡，在这次挑战中，社交媒体平台的用户敢于掐住自己的脖子直至昏迷。【原文：A U.S. appeals court has revived a lawsuit against TikTok by the mother of a 10-year-old girl who died after taking part in a viral "blackout challenge" in which users of the social media platform were dared to choke themselves until they passed out.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）结束对菲斯科海洋 SUV 的两项初步调查
item.description: 美国汽车安全监管机构周三表示，已经结束了对菲斯科 Ocean SUV 车门故障和制动性能下降的两项调查，此前这家电动汽车初创公司已发布召回公告以解决这些问题。【原文：The U.S. auto safety regulator said on Wednesday it has closed two separate probes into Fisker's Ocean SUVs over an alleged door malfunction and a loss of brake performance, after the electric-vehicle startup issued recalls to fix the problems.】

item.title: 亿万富翁投资者巴菲特最新出售价值 9.82 亿美元的美国银行股票
item.description: 亿万富翁沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）在过去几天里又抛售了一些美国银行的股票，获利 9.819 亿美元，因为这家企业集团在继续削减其在这家美国第二大银行的股份。【原文：Billionaire Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has sold some more shares of Bank of America over the past few days, raking in $981.9 million, as the conglomerate continues to trim down its stake in the second-largest U.S. lender.】

item.title: Bath & Body Works 因需求不振下调年度销售预期
item.description: Bath & Body Works 周三下调了年度销售预期，这表明在通胀率居高不下的情况下，香水和香薰蜡烛等高价产品的需求疲软。【原文：Bath & Body Works cut its annual sales forecast on Wednesday, a sign of weaker demand for its pricey products such as fragrances and scented candles in the face of still-high inflation.】

item.title: Abercrombie & Fitch上调年度销售预期，押注稳定需求
item.description: Abercrombie & Fitch 周三上调了对全年销售额的预期，认为其同名品牌的新款式和 Hollister 的强势品种将吸引更多的购物者。【原文：Abercrombie & Fitch lifted its forecast for annual sales on Wednesday, betting that new styles at its namesake label and a strong assortment at Hollister would draw more shoppers.】

item.title: 美国 30 年期抵押贷款利率降至 2023 年 4 月以来最低点
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）发出央行准备在下个月降低借贷成本以防止就业市场进一步疲软的信号后，美国最受欢迎的住房贷款利率降至16个月以来的最低点。【原文：The interest rate for the most popular U.S. home loan slid to its lowest in 16 months, after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled the central bank was ready to lower borrowing costs next month to keep the job market from weakening further.】

item.title: 科尔百货因库存减少而上调利润预期
item.description: 科尔百货公司（Kohl's）周三上调了年度利润预期，希望库存减少能带动更多的全价销售，尽管服装和配饰的需求依然低迷。【原文：Kohl's raised its annual profit forecast on Wednesday, betting on leaner inventories to drive more full-price sales, even as demand for apparel and accessories remains muted.】

item.title: 独家报道：哈里斯的硅谷愿望清单--堕胎权、支持科技政策
item.description: 在周三公布的一项调查中，承诺支持卡马拉-哈里斯竞选白宫的风险投资人列出了优先事项，其中包括妇女生育权、气候变化以及对初创企业更友好的态度。【原文：Venture capitalists pledging support for Kamala Harris' White House campaign listed priorities in a survey released on Wednesday that include women's reproductive rights, climate change and a friendlier stance toward startups.】

item.title: 印度竞争监管机构批准价值 85 亿美元的迪士尼--Reliance 媒体资产合并案
item.description: 印度竞争监管机构周三在社交媒体平台 X 上发文称，已批准信实工业公司和迪斯尼公司价值 85 亿美元的印度媒体资产合并案，但需进行某些自愿性修改。【原文：India's competition regulator has approved the $8.5 billion merger of Reliance Industries and Disney's Indian media assets, subject to certain voluntary modifications, it said in a post on social media platform X on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车巨头比亚迪上半年利润增长 24.4
item.description: 中国电动汽车巨头比亚迪周三公布上半年净利润增长24.4%，尽管在全球最大的汽车市场上，大件商品的支出出现下滑。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD reported a 24.4% rise in first-half net profit on Wednesday despite faltering spending on big-ticket items in the world's largest automobile market.】

item.title: 加拿大国家银行利润因财富管理和市场走强而增长
item.description: 加拿大国家银行周三公布，受助于财富管理和金融市场部门的强劲表现，第三季度利润有所增长。【原文：National Bank of Canada reported a higher third-quarter profit on Wednesday, helped by strong performance in its wealth management and financial markets units.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行利润因收购加拿大汇丰银行和资本市场走强而上升
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行周三公布第三季度利润增长，原因是该银行收购了加拿大汇丰银行，且资本市场业务表现强劲。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada reported a rise in third-quarter profit on Wednesday, as the country's largest lender benefited from the acquisition of HSBC Canada and robust performance in its capital markets business.】

item.title: 市场等待英伟达测试，期货价格低迷
item.description: 美国股指期货周三持平至小幅上涨，因为投资者在人工智能宠儿英伟达（Nvidia）发布关键的季度财报前按兵不动，以判断市场能否承受牛市反弹中的进一步冒险行为。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were flat-to-slightly higher on Wednesday, as investors held back ahead of a crucial quarterly earnings report from AI-favorite Nvidia to gauge if the market can withstand further risk-taking in a bull rally.】

item.title: 美国公司重拾货币期权以规避大选和宏观风险
item.description: 银行家们表示，由于担心美国总统大选和各国央行利率政策的分歧可能引发一段时期的货币波动，美国企业正再次转向外汇期权以保护其现金流。【原文：U.S. corporations are turning to foreign exchange options again to protect their cash flow as they fear the U.S. presidential election and diverging central bank interest-rate policies could spark a period of currency volatility, bankers said.】
